title: Peter Kelly (rugby league)
text:
Peter Kelly (born 17 September 1959) is an Australian former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1980s and 1990s. Originating from the New South Wales south coast town of <a href="Eden%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Eden</a>, he played <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23The%20front%20row">front-row</a> forward in the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Rugby%20League%20premiership">NSWRL Premiership</a> for <a href="Newtown%20Jets">Newtown</a>, <a href="Canterbury-Bankstown%20Bulldogs">Canterbury-Bankstown</a> and the <a href="Penrith%20Panthers">Penrith Panthers</a>. A noted "hard man" he won two premierships with Canterbury and was a two-time New South Wales State of Origin representative.
Playing career.
Kelly was selected to represent <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20state%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales</a> in the front-row for games II and III of the <a href="1989%20State%20of%20Origin%20series">1989 State of Origin series</a>.
Kelly appeared in three Grand Finals for Canterbury, the two Premiership-winning teams of <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Rugby%20League%20season%201984">1984</a> and <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Rugby%20League%20season%201985">1985</a>, and the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Rugby%20League%20season%201986">1986</a> runners-up. Kelly was man of the match in the 1984 NSWRL Grand Final and in retrospect was awarded the <a href="Clive%20Churchill%20Medal">Clive Churchill Medal</a> during rugby league's centenary celebrations in 2008.
